summary: States and the federal government pay managed care plans based on the number of Medicaid beneficiaries. The managed care plans then pay health care providers for services. Since 2017, states have been allowed to steer additional payments to providers to help the state achieve certain Medicaid goals. State directed payments should have been exceptions to the regular payment process, but they now comprise a significant...
title: Medicaid Managed Care: Rapid Spending Growth in State Directed Payments Needs Enhanced Oversight and Transparency
